alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary; Kootenai; Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 28 at 6:21AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Heavy rain may lead to significant rises on rivers, field flooding, and the heightened potential for rock slides in steep terrain. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...From 10 AM PST this morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Field flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage. There is also a heightened potential for rock and mudslides in steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rain will occur today through Wednesday morning. Melting snow will also contribute to runoff the next couple of days. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor forecasts and river levels. Be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
